channel.title: Request
channel.description:
Ok, I have a request, well first if such a program does exist can some one please give me a link, second, if it doesn't, can some one make it for me? It would be fairly easy for a semi experienced coder, but I cannot do it. What I want is a program for Texas hold'em, where I turn it on, hit new hand, enter my cards/the number of people/anything else that might help, then after the flop I enter those cards in, and it gives me percents of hands that I could get. like if I have 2 hearts and the flop has one heart, assuming no one else has a heart, and the turn is a heart, that leaves me with a 4% chance of getting a flush. I don't want a program that will play for me, just give me the percentages. Then I enter the turn and it gives me the percent of a chance that I will win the hand and the percent of the river being a card I need, then I enter the river and it gives me the percent of chance or w/e that I have the best hand.
Thanks for reading my post.

item.title: Request
item.dc:creator: @Exception Exception
item.description:
@Exception wrote:

Here’s the equation I found

add/subtract the cost of my action (calling/raising/etc)
for the next opponent
sum over all possible hole cards by him; weighted by the probability of each hole
he can choose {f,c,r}
for that hole, compute his probabilities of each P(f),P(c),P(r)
branch 3 ways and sum with the weights of his probabilities of each
adjust the pot for his actions in each case
continue

I’d do it, but I’m afraid I just don’t have the time or understanding. I’d be glad to help you out with any programming troubles if you want to take a stab at it yourself.
